name: Harry Potter: The Early Years Quiz Pack
author: Obot (Acorn Labs)
description: A magical quiz pack covering the first three Harry Potter books. Test your knowledge of Hogwarts, its students, and the wizarding world up through Prisoner of Azkaban.

rounds.theme_description: Moments and details from the beginnings of Harry's magical journey.

questions.question: What is the name of the train that takes students to Hogwarts?
questions.explanation: The Hogwarts Express departs from King's Cross Station, Platform 9¾, and brings students to Hogwarts each year.

questions.question: Which house does Draco Malfoy get sorted into?
questions.explanation: Draco Malfoy is sorted into Slytherin, known for ambition and cunning.

questions.question: Harry's first friend at Hogwarts is Ron Weasley.
questions.explanation: Harry meets Ron on the train and they quickly become friends.

questions.question: How old is Harry when he receives his Hogwarts letter? (in years)
questions.explanation: Harry turns 11 just before receiving his letter, the standard age for first-year students.

questions.question: What is the last name of the family Harry lives with before Hogwarts?
questions.explanation: Harry lives with his aunt, uncle, and cousin—the Dursleys—at 4 Privet Drive.

questions.question: Who delivers Harry's Hogwarts letter in person?
questions.explanation: Hagrid personally delivers Harry's letter after the Dursleys try to keep it from him.

rounds.theme_description: Magical creatures and companions at Hogwarts.

questions.question: What is the name of Hermione's cat, introduced in book 3?
questions.explanation: Crookshanks is Hermione's squashed-faced, clever cat, introduced in Prisoner of Azkaban.

questions.question: What type of animal is Scabbers?
questions.explanation: Scabbers is Ron's pet rat, who turns out to be more than he seems.

questions.question: Hedwig is a snowy owl.
questions.explanation: Harry's loyal pet, Hedwig, is a snowy owl given to him by Hagrid.

questions.question: How many heads does Fluffy, the dog guarding the trapdoor, have?
questions.explanation: Fluffy is a giant three-headed dog owned by Hagrid.

questions.question: What is the name of Hagrid's pet dragon in book 1?
questions.explanation: Norbert is a Norwegian Ridgeback dragon hatched by Hagrid in Sorcerer's Stone.

questions.question: What kind of creature is Trevor?
questions.explanation: Trevor is Neville Longbottom's pet toad.

rounds.theme_description: Spells gone wrong and magical accidents.

questions.question: What spell does Ron try to use to turn Scabbers yellow?
questions.explanation: Ron attempts a rhyme, not a real spell, to turn Scabbers yellow on the train.

questions.question: What happens when Harry tries to use Floo Powder for the first time?
options: He ends up in Knockturn Alley
questions.answer: He ends up in Knockturn Alley
questions.explanation: Harry mispronounces 'Diagon Alley' and ends up in the dark Knockturn Alley.

questions.question: Hermione accidentally turns herself into a cat in book 2.
questions.explanation: Hermione uses a hair from Millicent Bulstrode's cat in Polyjuice Potion, turning herself part-cat.

questions.question: How many points does Gryffindor lose when Harry, Hermione, and Neville are caught out of bed in book 1?
questions.explanation: They lose 50 points each, totaling 150 points for Gryffindor.

questions.question: Who gets turned into a ferret by Professor Moody (Barty Crouch Jr.)? (Trick: Only up to book 3)
questions.explanation: This event happens in book 4, not in the first three books.

questions.question: What does Neville receive from Professor McGonagall after forgetting the password?
questions.explanation: Neville receives a Howler from his grandmother for forgetting the password to Gryffindor Tower.

rounds.theme_description: Breaking and following the rules at Hogwarts.

questions.question: What is the name of the caretaker who patrols Hogwarts with his cat?
questions.explanation: Argus Filch is the cantankerous caretaker, often accompanied by his cat, Mrs. Norris.

questions.question: Which corridor is forbidden in Harry's first year?
questions.explanation: The third-floor corridor is forbidden because it hides the trapdoor to the Sorcerer's Stone.

questions.question: Fred and George Weasley give Harry the Marauder's Map in book 3.
questions.explanation: The twins give Harry the Marauder's Map so he can sneak into Hogsmeade.

questions.question: How many house points does Dumbledore award Neville at the end of book 1?
questions.explanation: Neville receives 10 points for standing up to his friends, helping Gryffindor win the House Cup.

questions.question: What magical object allows Harry to become invisible?
questions.explanation: Harry receives the Invisibility Cloak as a Christmas present in his first year.

questions.question: Who is the strict head of Gryffindor House?
questions.explanation: Professor McGonagall is the head of Gryffindor House and Transfiguration teacher.

rounds.theme_description: Sports, games, and rivalries at Hogwarts.

questions.question: What position does Harry play on the Gryffindor Quidditch team?
questions.explanation: Harry is the youngest Seeker in a century, responsible for catching the Golden Snitch.

questions.question: Which ball is used to score points in Quidditch?
questions.explanation: The Quaffle is used to score goals, worth 10 points each.

questions.question: Slytherin wins the Quidditch Cup in Harry's first year.
questions.explanation: Gryffindor wins the House Cup, but the Quidditch Cup is not awarded in book 1.

questions.question: How many players are on a Quidditch team?
questions.explanation: Each Quidditch team has 7 players: 3 Chasers, 2 Beaters, 1 Keeper, and 1 Seeker.

questions.question: Who is the captain of the Gryffindor Quidditch team in book 1?
questions.explanation: Oliver Wood is the dedicated captain and Keeper for Gryffindor.

questions.question: Which team is Gryffindor's main rival in Quidditch?
questions.explanation: Gryffindor and Slytherin have a fierce rivalry, especially in Quidditch.

rounds.theme_description: Mysterious places and secret passages at Hogwarts.

questions.question: What is the name of the chamber beneath the trapdoor where the Philosopher's Stone is hidden?
questions.explanation: The Stone is hidden in a chamber beneath the trapdoor, protected by magical obstacles set by Hogwarts staff.

questions.question: What creature is hidden in the Chamber of Secrets?
questions.explanation: The Chamber of Secrets houses a deadly Basilisk controlled by the Heir of Slytherin.

questions.question: The Marauder's Map shows every person at Hogwarts.
questions.explanation: The Marauder's Map reveals the location of everyone in the castle, including secret passages.

questions.question: How many secret passages out of Hogwarts are shown on the Marauder's Map?
questions.explanation: The Marauder's Map shows seven secret passages leading out of Hogwarts.

questions.question: What is the password to Dumbledore's office in book 2?
questions.explanation: Dumbledore's office password in Chamber of Secrets is 'Sherbet Lemon,' a Muggle sweet.

questions.question: Who opens the Chamber of Secrets in book 2?
questions.explanation: Ginny Weasley, under the influence of Tom Riddle's diary, opens the Chamber of Secrets.

rounds.theme_description: Professors, classes, and magical education at Hogwarts.

questions.question: Who teaches Potions at Hogwarts?
questions.explanation: Professor Snape is the Potions Master and head of Slytherin House.

questions.question: Which subject does Professor Sprout teach?
questions.explanation: Professor Sprout is the Herbology teacher and head of Hufflepuff House.

questions.question: Professor Lupin teaches Defense Against the Dark Arts in book 3.
questions.explanation: Remus Lupin is the popular Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher in Prisoner of Azkaban.

questions.question: How many different Defense Against the Dark Arts teachers has Harry had by the end of book 3?
questions.explanation: Harry has had three: Quirrell, Lockhart, and Lupin.

questions.question: Who teaches Transfiguration?
questions.explanation: Professor McGonagall is the strict but fair Transfiguration teacher.

questions.question: Which teacher is revealed to be a werewolf?
questions.explanation: Remus Lupin's secret is revealed in Prisoner of Azkaban.

rounds.theme_description: Bonds, backgrounds, and relationships in the wizarding world.

questions.question: What is Ron's youngest sister's name?
questions.explanation: Ginny Weasley is Ron's only sister and the youngest Weasley sibling.

questions.question: Who is Harry's godfather, introduced in book 3?
questions.explanation: Sirius Black is revealed to be Harry's godfather in Prisoner of Azkaban.

questions.question: Hermione is Muggle-born.
questions.explanation: Hermione's parents are both non-magical dentists.

questions.question: How many Weasley siblings are there (including Ron)?
questions.explanation: There are seven Weasley children: Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred, George, Ron, and Ginny.

questions.question: What is Hermione's parents' profession?
questions.explanation: Hermione's parents are both dentists, a fact she mentions several times.

questions.question: Who is Percy Weasley's girlfriend in book 3?
questions.explanation: Penelope Clearwater is a Ravenclaw prefect and Percy's girlfriend.

rounds.theme_description: Villains, curses, and magical threats from the first three books.

questions.question: What is the name of the dark wizard who killed Harry's parents?
questions.explanation: Lord Voldemort, also known as He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named, is the main antagonist.

questions.question: What creature petrifies students in book 2?
questions.explanation: The Basilisk's gaze causes petrification in Chamber of Secrets.

questions.question: Dementors guard the entrance to the Chamber of Secrets.
questions.explanation: Dementors guard Azkaban and later Hogwarts, not the Chamber of Secrets.

questions.question: How many times does Harry face Voldemort directly in the first three books?
questions.explanation: Harry faces Voldemort in each of the first three books: the Stone, the diary, and the Shrieking Shack.

questions.question: What is the incantation for the spell that repels Dementors?
questions.explanation: 'Expecto Patronum' conjures a Patronus to ward off Dementors, taught to Harry by Lupin.

questions.question: Who is revealed to be the true owner of Scabbers?
questions.explanation: Scabbers is actually Peter Pettigrew, an Animagus hiding from the wizarding world.

rounds.theme_description: Riddles, cleverness, and magical trivia from the first three books.

questions.question: What is the name of the ghost who haunts the girls' bathroom?
questions.explanation: Moaning Myrtle haunts a bathroom at Hogwarts and plays a key role in Chamber of Secrets.

questions.question: Which of these plants helps Harry breathe underwater in the first three books?
questions.explanation: Gillyweed is introduced in book 4, not in the first three books.

questions.question: The Sorting Hat once belonged to Godric Gryffindor.
questions.explanation: The Sorting Hat originally belonged to Godric Gryffindor and was enchanted to sort students.

questions.question: How many staircases are there at Hogwarts?
questions.explanation: Hogwarts is famous for its 142 shifting staircases.

questions.question: What is the name of the wizarding village near Hogwarts?
questions.explanation: Hogsmeade is the only all-wizarding village in Britain, visited by students from third year on.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a password to Gryffindor Tower in the first three books?
questions.explanation: 'Sherbet Lemon' is Dumbledore's office password, not for Gryffindor Tower.
